column4: How I do this? /usr/games -> Point to allacrost.exe then run ./allacrost -i
cd to the dir where the game is at,, run it from the terminal
if the comallamand is          allacrost -i , then you run      allacrost -i ?
from a terminal it shoudl spit out info .
dont 'click' use the shell, is what seems to be needed.
open a shell, cd to where that game is at. (cd /usr/game/whatever) then RUN thge command  ./whatever -i
it may be time to learn some bash basics.   You are most liklely doing somthing fundamental wrong.
it may be you are in the wrong directory, use 'ls' and LOOK and see what files are there
also the command   'which  allacrost' will tell you where its at
you are getting things way confused..   ./allacrost -i  will run a program in the current dir. try it with out the ./
logical - since the directory does not exist.
Your useeage/command is making no sence at all. Perhaps you should start from the beginning with what you are trying to do.
'cd /usr/game' makes sence. 'cd ~' will go to your /home/username dir.
you are confusing several things at once.. earlier you were trying to 'cd' to a file.
Huh? you mean the irc server ports?
